head.supplied: 1/6/80. ¶ ¶ I intended to call on you at Gov House, dear Dr Hector, to enjoy a talk with you after 18 years once more; but when I went you had just taken your departure for Hobarton. ¶ At the evenin...

div.p: MU 94, box 4 (4440/80), Museum of New Zealand Te Papa Tongarewa Archives, Wellington.

1/6/80.
M's letter was registered at the Geological Survey Office, Wellington on 21 June 1880.

I intended to call on you at Gov House, dear Dr Hector, to enjoy a talk with you after 18 years once more; but when I went you had just taken your departure for Hobarton.
Now Hobart, Tas. At the evening of her Majesty's Birthday
24 May. I went with the Italian Consul General, who drove me up to Gov. Palace, so that I kept with that noble-man on the table, otherwise I would have endeavoured to get a seat near you.
It devolves yet on me to thank you for having advertised for tenders for Kauri-seeds. Meanwhile a supply reached the Melbourne Market, which I bought, so that I shall not require any more at present.
